alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 10 at 9:08AM CDT until April 15 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Big Sioux River below Dell Rapids affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River at Akron affecting Union and Plymouth Counties. Rock River at Luverne affecting Rock County. Rock River at Rock Rapids affecting Lyon County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Iowa...Minnesota... Split Rock Creek near Corson affecting Minnehaha County. Big Sioux River near Bruce affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Canton affecting Lyon, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Big Sioux River near Egan affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River near Trent affecting Moody County. Big Sioux River above Hawarden affecting Union, Lincoln and Sioux Counties. Sixmile Creek near Brookings affecting Brookings County. Big Sioux River near Brookings affecting Moody and Brookings Counties. Rock River near Hardwick affecting Rock County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rock River at Rock Rapids. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, the higher banks on the left side of the river, and the lower banks on the right side, will begin flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 AM CDT Monday the stage was 12.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 14.6 feet early Wednesday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Rock River Rock Rapid 13.0 12.7 Mon 8 am 13.8 14.5 14.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 1115 AM CDT.
